title: Development of Self-sustained Culture-based Inland Fisheries
decision_details: - The Government of Japan has agreed to provide a grant of US$ 3 million for the Project for Development of Self-sustained Culture-based Inland Fisheries to Ensure Food and Nutrition Security and Livelihood Improvements in Rural Communities to be implemented by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO). The proposed project is planned to be implemented in Anuradhapura, Batticaloa, Mullaitivu and Monaragala Districts and is expected to increase inland fish production in the selected reservoirs and ensure sustainability of the inland fishery industry. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries to exempt the relevant taxes for goods and equipment to be imported for the implementation of the said Project, was approved by the Cabinet.
